SCORE-driven CRE treatment


============================================
ANTI-CRE THERAPY EFFECTIVENESS ANALYSIS
Based on score_impact___2 (Therapy Started)
============================================

=== Understanding the Variables ===
score_impact___1 = No action taken
score_impact___2 = Anti-CRE therapy started (OUR FOCUS)
score_impact___3 = Diagnostic test performed

=== Processing Score Impact Data ===

Score assessments processed: 655

Assessments with no action: 572 ( 87.3 %)

=== Treatment Effectiveness Metrics ===
Infection rate WITHOUT score-based therapy: 23 %
Infection rate WITH score-based therapy: 61.1 %
Absolute Risk Reduction (ARR): -38.16 %
Relative Risk Reduction (RRR): -166.27 %

âœ— Score-based therapy appears HARMFUL (paradox - likely confounding)
  Note: High-risk patients more likely to receive therapy

============================================
THERAPY EFFECTIVENESS SUMMARY
============================================

1. KEY FINDING:
   âœ— Paradox detected: Therapy group has HIGHER infection rate
   - Likely due to confounding by indication
   - High-risk patients â†’ Get therapy AND get infected

2. CLINICAL INTERPRETATION:
   - Score successfully identifies high-risk patients
   - These patients appropriately receive therapy
   - True effectiveness requires risk adjustment or RCT

3. RECOMMENDATIONS:
   - Review therapy effectiveness
   - Consider alternative interventions

Analysis Complete

============================================
DIAGNOSTIC TEST UTILIZATION SUMMARY
============================================

1. KEY FINDINGS:
   âœ— Diagnostic testing associated with HIGHER infection rates
   - Likely confounding by indication
   - Sicker patients receive more diagnostic tests

2. UTILIZATION PATTERNS:
   -  19.6 % of patients received diagnostic tests
   - Higher scores â†’ More diagnostic testing
   - Testing correlates with risk stratification

3. CLINICAL IMPLICATIONS:
   - Diagnostic tests help identify at-risk patients
   - May enable early intervention
   - Consider diagnostic protocols based on score thresholds

4. COMPARISON WITH THERAPY:
   - Best outcomes: Neither 
   - Worst outcomes: Diagnostic Only
